metadata.description: Encode a sentence in English into Pig Latin
metadata.task_prefix: Pig Latin looks just like English, but if an English word starts with a vowel you add -yay at the end of the word (ice -> iceyay); if it starts with consonants, you move them to end of the word and add -ay (prank -> ankpray); if it is capitalized, the Pig Latin word is capitalized as well (Maggie -> Aggiemay). Translate English into Pig Latin.

4.input: I am not a good swimmer.
4.output: Iay amay otnay ay oodgay immersway.

6.input: Sami is the one who messed up.
6.output: Amisay isay ethay oneay owhay essedmay upay.

7.input: Ted was finally able to communicate his thoughts in Japanese.
7.output: Edtay asway inallyfay ableay otay ommunicatecay ishay oughtsthay inay Apanesejay.

8.input: She asked him to read it for her.
8.output: Eshay askeday imhay otay eadray itay orfay erhay.

9.input: We enjoyed driving along the new expressway.
9.output: Eway enjoyeday ivingdray alongay ethay ewnay expresswayay.

10.input: She was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
10.output: Eshay asway aughtcay inay ay owershay anday otgay etway otay ethay inskay.

14.input: Layla is still working to regain her health.
14.output: Aylalay isay illstay orkingway otay egainray erhay ealthhay.

15.input: What I wanted to say concerns this particular issue.
15.output: Atwhay Iay antedway otay aysay oncernscay isthay articularpay issueay.

16.input: Can Tom do that instead of me?
16.output: Ancay Omtay oday atthay insteaday ofay emay?

17.input: Maybe Tom will apologize to Mary.
17.output: Aybemay Omtay illway apologizeay otay Arymay.

18.input: Tom said that he knew Mary wanted to do that.
18.output: Omtay aidsay atthay ehay ewknay Arymay antedway otay oday atthay.

19.input: Tom held a glass filled with wine in his left hand.
19.output: Omtay eldhay ay assglay illedfay ithway ineway inay ishay eftlay andhay.

20.input: They want to call their lawyers.
20.output: Eythay antway otay allcay eirthay awyerslay.

23.input: Many projects are on hold in Algeria.
23.output: Anymay ojectspray areay onay oldhay inay Algeriay.

24.input: Tom advised me not to go there alone.
24.output: Omtay adviseday emay otnay otay ogay erethay aloneay.

25.input: The last time we were here was three years ago.
25.output: Ethay astlay imetay eway ereway erehay asway eethray earsyay agoay.

29.input: Tom sat down next to his brother.
29.output: Omtay atsay ownday extnay otay ishay otherbray.

30.input: Wyoming is famous for its great skiing.
30.output: Omingwyay isay amousfay orfay itsay eatgray iingskay.

31.input: Has it occurred to you that you might be the one with the problem?
31.output: Ashay itay occurreday otay ouyay atthay ouyay ightmay ebay ethay oneay ithway ethay oblempray?

33.input: Tom can type much faster than Mary can.
33.output: Omtay ancay etypay uchmay asterfay anthay Arymay ancay.

35.input: They know they need to do that today.
35.output: Eythay owknay eythay eednay otay oday atthay odaytay.

36.input: She wanted to go out anyway.
36.output: Eshay antedway otay ogay outay anywayay.

37.input: Tom and Mary seem to be influential.
37.output: Omtay anday Arymay eemsay otay ebay influentialay.

38.input: Many advantages accrue to society from the freedom of speech.
38.output: Anymay advantagesay accrueay otay ocietysay omfray ethay eedomfray ofay eechspay.

40.input: Everything will work out in due course.
40.output: Everythingay illway orkway outay inay ueday oursecay.

41.input: Algeria will not become a new Syria.
41.output: Algeriay illway otnay ecomebay ay ewnay Iasyray.

42.input: Skura is here for a Kabyle dress.
42.output: Uraskay isay erehay orfay ay Abylekay essdray.

44.input: Tom told me that he thought Mary was sleepy.
44.output: Omtay oldtay emay atthay ehay oughtthay Arymay asway eepyslay.

45.input: Sami choked the life out of Layla.
45.output: Amisay okedchay ethay ifelay outay ofay Aylalay.

46.input: Are they free on Friday afternoon?
46.output: Areay eythay eefray onay Idayfray afternoonay?

48.input: The population of the town was wiped out.
48.output: Ethay opulationpay ofay ethay owntay asway ipedway outay.

49.input: Rome is a city worth visiting.
49.output: Omeray isay ay itycay orthway isitingvay.

50.input: Tom said that he thought Mary would win.
50.output: Omtay aidsay atthay ehay oughtthay Arymay ouldway inway.

51.input: When was the last time you were on a date?
51.output: Enwhay asway ethay astlay imetay ouyay ereway onay ay ateday?

53.input: They usually went to the shopping mall on Monday.
53.output: Eythay usuallyay entway otay ethay oppingshay allmay onay Ondaymay.

54.input: Tom was alone most of the time.
54.output: Omtay asway aloneay ostmay ofay ethay imetay.

55.input: You did wrong to refuse his help.
55.output: Ouyay idday ongwray otay efuseray ishay elphay.

56.input: Tom wondered whether Mary liked swimming.
56.output: Omtay onderedway etherwhay Arymay ikedlay immingsway.

57.input: Tom crossed his eyes when looking at the tip of his nose.
57.output: Omtay ossedcray ishay eyesay enwhay ookinglay atay ethay iptay ofay ishay osenay.

58.input: Tom described the incident in detail.
58.output: Omtay escribedday ethay incidentay inay etailday.

59.input: Yanni was in the living room.
59.output: Anniyay asway inay ethay ivinglay oomray.

60.input: The can will do for an ashtray.
60.output: Ethay ancay illway oday orfay anay ashtrayay.

61.input: The Banu Hilal that came to North Africa heavily intermixed with local Berbers.
61.output: Ethay Anubay Ilalhay atthay amecay otay Orthnay Africay eavilyhay intermixeday ithway ocallay Erbersbay.

62.input: I think I could do that if you showed me how.
62.output: Iay inkthay Iay ouldcay oday atthay ifay ouyay owedshay emay owhay.

63.input: I told Tom you used to live in Boston.
63.output: Iay oldtay Omtay ouyay useday otay ivelay inay Ostonbay.

64.input: I wonder whether Tom knows that Mary is coming with us.
64.output: Iay onderway etherwhay Omtay owsknay atthay Arymay isay omingcay ithway usay.

66.input: Tom said Mary had to do that today.
66.output: Omtay aidsay Arymay adhay otay oday atthay odaytay.

67.input: The cold weather has turned the leaves red.
67.output: Ethay oldcay eatherway ashay urnedtay ethay eaveslay edray.

68.input: She asked us to be quiet.
68.output: Eshay askeday usay otay ebay uietqay.

70.input: I always knew you were going to be successful one day.
70.output: Iay alwaysay ewknay ouyay ereway oinggay otay ebay uccessfulsay oneay ayday.

71.input: This cup has a crack in it.
71.output: Isthay upcay ashay ay ackcray inay itay.

72.input: No one was hurt in the robbery.
72.output: Onay oneay asway urthay inay ethay obberyray.

73.input: Does that sound familiar to you?
73.output: Oesday atthay oundsay amiliarfay otay ouyay?

74.input: Where do you want to go for our first lesson?
74.output: Erewhay oday ouyay antway otay ogay orfay ouray irstfay essonlay?

75.input: Do you think that Tom is still tense?
75.output: Oday ouyay inkthay atthay Omtay isay illstay ensetay?

76.input: You never mentioned that to me.
76.output: Ouyay evernay entionedmay atthay otay emay.

78.input: How far is it from here to the closest police station?
78.output: Owhay arfay isay itay omfray erehay otay ethay osestclay olicepay ationstay?

80.input: Do you want to do something else?
80.output: Oday ouyay antway otay oday omethingsay elseay?

81.input: She wants me to do that for her.
81.output: Eshay antsway emay otay oday atthay orfay erhay.

82.input: They said that they should do that.
82.output: Eythay aidsay atthay eythay ouldshay oday atthay.

83.input: You were crossed off the list.
83.output: Ouyay ereway ossedcray offay ethay istlay.

84.input: I have her on the line.
84.output: Iay avehay erhay onay ethay inelay.

85.input: Tom stole a lot of money from Mary.
85.output: Omtay olestay ay otlay ofay oneymay omfray Arymay.

87.input: You seem to have thought of something else.
87.output: Ouyay eemsay otay avehay oughtthay ofay omethingsay elseay.

89.input: Tom and Mary like their jobs a lot.
89.output: Omtay anday Arymay ikelay eirthay obsjay ay otlay.

90.input: I need to lose a bit of weight.
90.output: Iay eednay otay oselay ay itbay ofay eightway.

91.input: His decision to stay there was a surprise to all of us.
91.output: Ishay ecisionday otay aystay erethay asway ay urprisesay otay allay ofay usay.

92.input: I thought that Tom was still single.
92.output: Iay oughtthay atthay Omtay asway illstay inglesay.

93.input: Tom appears to be a friendly guy.
93.output: Omtay appearsay otay ebay ay iendlyfray uygay.

95.input: Sami had a strange way of expressing sympathy.
95.output: Amisay adhay ay angestray ayway ofay expressingay athysympay.

98.input: Tom told me he thought that Mary was competent.
98.output: Omtay oldtay emay ehay oughtthay atthay Arymay asway ompetentcay.

99.input: Mary said that she knew I was coming.
99.output: Arymay aidsay atthay eshay ewknay Iay asway omingcay.
